title: 112_hr1447
content: The "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012" may be cited as the short title. It establishes the Aviation Security Advisory Committee. The "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012" establishes the Aviation Security Advisory Committee within the Transportation Security Administration. The committee will advise on aviation security matters and develop recommendations for improvements. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee will develop recommendations for improvements to aviation security at the request of the Assistant Secretary. Recommendations agreed upon by working groups will be approved by the Advisory Committee for transmission to the Assistant Secretary. The Advisory Committee will periodically submit reports on identified matters and an annual report to the Assistant Secretary. The Advisory Committee will submit an annual report to the Assistant Secretary, detailing its activities, findings, and recommendations from the previous year. The Committee's membership consists of individuals representing up to 27 member organizations, with each organization being represented by one individual or their designee. The Advisory Committee membership includes representatives from various sectors such as air carriers, labor organizations, aircraft manufacturers, and more. The Assistant Secretary has the authority to remove a member for cause at any time, and members are not compensated for their service. The Advisory Committee members do not receive pay or benefits from the Government for their service. The Assistant Secretary mandates the Committee to meet at least semiannually and may convene additional meetings as needed. Additionally, an air cargo security working group is established within the Committee to provide recommendations on air cargo security issues and meet regularly. The Assistant Secretary establishes a general aviation security working group within the Advisory Committee, which includes members with expertise in air cargo operations and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. The working group meets quarterly to provide recommendations on air cargo security initiatives. The Assistant Secretary establishes a general aviation security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on transportation security issues for general aviation facilities, aircraft, and helicopter operations at airports. The working group meets quarterly and includes members with expertise in general aviation. The Assistant Secretary establishes a perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on improving airport perimeter security and access control procedures. The working group includes members with expertise in general aviation and meets quarterly to submit recommendations to the Advisory Committee for inclusion in the annual report. The Advisory Committee establishes a perimeter security working group with expertise in airport security issues. The group meets quarterly to provide recommendations for the annual report, cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to the Advisory Committee or its working groups. Definitions for Advisory Committee and annual report are provided in this section. The curr_chunk defines terms related to airport security, including annual report, Assistant Secretary, and perimeter security. It clarifies that perimeter security includes procedures to monitor and secure airports. The House of Representatives passed the Aviation Security Advisory Committee bill on June 28, 2012.
